page.title: 02Rye Harbour
page.content: Rye Harbour is situated 2 miles south of Rye on the west bank of the { {River Rother.}It has a resident population of about 400 people of all age groups.The village developed during the {19th Century}and changes in the shoreline means that Rye Harbour is now 3/4 mile inland. The{Watch House}is the oldest house in the village.It was originally a customs and look-out;it was built in 1835.Other buildings of note include the{Church of the Holy Spirit,}the {Martello Tower,}and some of the houses at the Point particularly{Ship Cottage Today Rye Harbour has two general shops,one a sub post office,two public houses,a village hall which also contains a snooker club and a social club opened daily.Rye Sailing Club has a Club house and Frenchman's Beach Caravan Park has space for 200 vans.
